author: andrewhong5297
content: Hey everyone! I'm working on this dev community analytics product, and want to pilot it in a few of my favorite defi discords. The goal is to help analyze all the repeated questions/pain points new devs come to the discord with, to then ease the dev community onboarding process. Feel free to dm me if you'd be interested in learning more ðŸ™‚

author: foobar0x
content:
My question is this: EOA calls Contract A which calls Contract B.

Contract B is fixed, but Contract A is under development. Is there any way to modify the `msg.sender` variable seen by B to refer to EOA, rather than A?

author: sky.cactus
content: There is a Solidity matrix room: https://matrix.to/#/!poXqlbVpQfXKWGseLY:gitter.im

author: agusx1211
content: Not directly, the closest thing is using something like openzep context, but you would need to overwrite those methods with more complex logic https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/utils/Context.sol

author: foobar0x
content: Thanks for the response! In that case we would need Contract B to be checking `_msgSender()` rather than `msg.sender`, right?
